title: a.mont, The Epitome of Korean Workwear -- SEOUL, South Kore
text:
SEOUL, South Korea , Sept. 18,   A South Korean workwear brand determined to refine the concept of uniforms is becoming a hot topic for the media. Known as a.mont ( www.a-mont.com ), which runs an online shopping mall carries uniforms designed and produced by professional designers. a.mont's products have been sold worldwide including Korea and America thanks to the excellent quality and outstanding design. a.mont carries uniforms and workwear actually produced by professional designers. Customers include those in the restaurant business such as caf e s, restaurants, and hotels, and large corporations and cosmetics companies as well. 
"Uniforms only had to be neat and clean in the past," said President of a.mont, Kim Hyuk (32), "However, today's trend for workwear is to reflect the culture and characteristics of the occupation or the company, and we reflect such demands in our products."
a.mont's products are quite practical for they have applied the '3D Pattern Method' which is to design the uniform following the curves of the body for better comfort even after wearing it for a long time. The company has also consistently engaged in research activities to develop products customized to each occupation. For example, a.mont uses stain resistant, breathable, and wrinkle-free fabric for chef's uniform.
a.mont's products can be purchased through the brand's online shopping mall. Its Korean and English pages (en-amont.com) were developed with Korea's largest electronic commerce solution brand, 'cafe24 ( www.cafe24.com ).' Japanese and Chinese pages will be added soon and the scope of products will cover more occupations.
President Kim said, "We are operating the Design Research Center with 17 professional designers to study the trends in the world's fashion centers and to develop more refined uniforms," and added, "We will continue to make efforts until everyone in the world work in comfortable uniforms regardless of their occupations."
